examples: he trod lightly, trying to make as little contact with the mud as possible
synonyms: trudge "he trod purposefully down the hall"

definitions.definition: set one's foot down on top of.

examples: shoppers will soon be treading the floors of the new shopping mall

definitions.definition: press down into the ground or another surface with the feet.
examples: food and cigarette butts had been trodden into the carpet

definitions.definition: crush or flatten something with the feet.
examples: the snow had been trodden down by the horses
synonyms: stomp on "the snow had been trodden down by the horses"

definitions.definition: a manner or the sound of someone walking.
examples: I heard the heavy tread of Dad's boots
synonyms: thump; clip-clop "we heard her heavy tread on the stairs"

definitions.definition: the top surface of a step or stair.
the thick molded part of a vehicle tire that grips the road.
the part of a wheel that touches the ground or rail.
the upper surface of a railroad track, in contact with the wheels.
the part of the sole of a shoe that rests on the ground.
